page.title: 01Between Allanton & Whitsome
page.content: This block is totally agricultural,mostly arable, with an open rolling aspect, roads generally straight and of good width, wide grass verges, hedges neatly trimmmd by machine, often with shelter belts beyond. This, together with the general flatness of the land, gives the area a feeling of spaciousness, which is further emphasised by its emptiness, as very few farmworkers are nowepoyed. There is no dairying, and only a few fields have beef cattle or sheep. The 8 farmsteds are in generally good condition, the original buildings being mostly C19 stonebuilt. Two farms have new bungalows for workers, but most of the older cottages are used for storage or stand empty. Silos break the skyline. The shelter belts and spinneys cover about 10% of th land and house
